meanings.definition: to move quickly out of the way
meanings.sent1: She duckishes when the ball comes towards her.
meanings.sent2: The cat duckishes under the table when it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel duckishes away from the falling acorn.
meanings.sent4: The child duckishes around the other players to score a goal.
meanings.sent5: He duckishes past the obstacles to reach the finish line first.

meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky are duckishes, fluffy, and white.
meanings.sent5: The little duckishes hat completes her duck costume perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The pond is home to many duckishes.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of duckishes swimming gracefully in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The duckishes waddle around the park looking for food.
